Description: Textile; two fragments of narrow wool braid; warp-patterned tablet-woven (12 four-hole tablets), plaiting; chevrons in green and red with border stripes in blue and yellow. Fragment (a) finishes with a plait made by bundles of warp threads wrapped around with other threads. Warp: Z-spun wool, ca 48 threads in 1.1cm Weft: Z-spun wool, ca 8 picks/cm Edges: selvedges, plait or fragmentary.
Curator's comments: History of use: use uncertain. Direction of spin, Z, points to comparativelt late date. H. Granger-Taylor, 19/09/1989
Condition: Fair - conservation (unknown date): stuck to a sticky net.
